questions.question_text: What happens when a quarantined file is released?

discussion.content: B is the correct answer. This is true for a single host. For all hosts, you would need to apply to a global policy.

choices.A: It is moved into the C:\CrowdStrike\Quarantine\Released folder on the host
choices.D: It is allowed to execute on all hosts
choices.B: It is allowed to execute on the host

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the answer. Your options in the Host Timeline are Hostname, Agent ID, Event Types, Company, and Timeline.

Selected Answer: B
Event Types is present in host timeline

questions.question_text: When reviewing a Host Timeline, which of the following filters is available?
Which is TRUE regarding a file released from quarantine?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Not allowed to execute on all hosts, see Crowdstrike documentation

Selected Answer: D
agree with answer D

Selected Answer: D
So far I've only seen all quarantined files are matched by ML PUP detection. None coming from IoA detection.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct for the Single host. Need to add to global policy for "all hosts"
When you release a file from quarantine, it's allowed to execute on that host. Releasing a file does not affect other hosts.

Selected Answer: D
I agree with D

choices.A: No executions are allowed for 14 days after release
choices.D: It will not generate future machine learning detections on the associated host
choices.B: It is allowed to execute on all hosts

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct answer, because it is asking "two" conditions. status="In-progress" and " Assigned to".

Not answer A, because A is only "one" condition.

D is correct answer, because it is asking "two" conditions. status="In-progress" and " Assigned to".

Not answer A, because A is only "one" condition.

Selected Answer: D
D is the answer. Endpoint Security> Endpoint Detections your filters include " Assigned to, and Status". May need to add the filter however from the "add filter" button.

Selected Answer: D
I agree with D, you can also filter by status="In-progress"

comments.content: It's written as 'In Progress' in the UI but you can do this I guess

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
can not be else

questions.question_text: From the Detections page, how can you view 'in-progress' detections assigned to Falcon Analyst Alex?

choices.B: Alex does not have the correct role permissions as a Falcon Analyst to be assigned detections

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
agree with A

Selected Answer: A
A is the answer. Domain search under Investigate only gives your Domain Lookup Summary and Processes that looked up specified Domains.
The answer is A. No IP information on the Domain Search page.

Selected Answer: A
I agree with A.

Selected Answer: A
Processes that looked up specified Domain(s)

questions.question_text: The Bulk Domain Search tool contains Domain information along with which of the following?
